com.camerontec.catalys.util.notification

Class ListenerQueue

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.util.notification.ListenerQueue
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ICatalysEventListener, IListenerWrapper, EventListener

    public class ListenerQueue
extends Object
implements ICatalysEventListener, IListenerWrapper
    Used to decouple the notification of listeners.

    This is used to queue requests to send events to a listener. Instead of sending an event directly to a listener, the event is put on the listener's queue.

    If the queue is flagged as not being "passive", a separate thread works continuously pulling events off the queue and actually sending them to the listener.

    This is an effective way of handling slow listeners.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ListenerQueue

        public ListenerQueue(EventListener listener,
                     int maxQ,
                     INotifier notifier,
                     boolean passive)
        Create a queue for the given listener.
        Parameters:
        listener - Actual listener.
        maxQ - Maximum queue length if > 0 otherwise unlimited.
        notifier - This determines how events are sent to the listener. If null, the listener is assumed to be an ICatalysEventListener and the notify method is called.
        passive - If true, no thread is called to process this queue when start is called. When false, a dedicated thread is called to process (ie fire) the events on the queue.

      • ListenerQueue

        public ListenerQueue(EventListener listener,
                     int maxQ,
                     INotifier notifier)
        Creates an active (ie not passive) queue.

        Equivalent to ListenerQueue( listener, maxQ, notifier, false ).

        Parameters:
        listener - Actual listener.
        maxQ - Maximum queue length if > 0 otherwise unlimited.
        notifier - This determines how events are sent to the listener. If null, the listener is assumed to be an ICatalysEventListener and the notify method is called.

      • ListenerQueue

        public ListenerQueue(EventListener listener,
                     int maxQ)
        Create a queue for the given listener. The listener is assumed to be a ICatalysEventListener. It will be notified of events by calling its notify method.
        Parameters:
        listener - Actual listener.
        maxQ - Maximum queue length if > 0 otherwise unlimited.

      • ListenerQueue

        public ListenerQueue(EventListener listener,
                     INotifier notifier)
        Create a queue for the given listener.
        Parameters:
        listener - Actual listener.
        notifier - This determines how events are sent to the listener. If null, the listener is assumed to be an ICatalysEventListener and the notify method is called.

      • getNextSelectedEvent

        public CatalysEventObject getNextSelectedEvent()
        Gets next entry off queue, if any.

        Returns null if there are no events on the queue or if the next event is not selected (as defined by the selector, if any).

        Returns:
        The next entry on the queue or null if none or not selected.

      • getRemovalException

        public Exception getRemovalException()
        Returns the exception, if any, that caused this listener to be removed.

        Null if the listener is still active.

        Returns:
        Exception which caused removal, if any. Null if none.

      • getWrappedListener

        public EventListener getWrappedListener()
        Gets actual listener associated with this queue.
        Specified by:

        Returns:
        the enclosed listener.

      • isPassive

        public boolean isPassive()
        True if this queue does not process its own contents - ie remove events from the queue and fire them.
        Returns:
        True if passive.

      • isRemoveOnException

        public boolean isRemoveOnException()
        True if this queue should be shutdown if an exception occurs when trying to send an event from the queue to its listener.
        Returns:
        True if queue should be shutdown on an exception.

        Number of events in queue.
        Returns:

      • start

        public void start()
        If this queue is not passive, creates and starts a thread which processes the queue.

        Does nothing if queue is passive or if thread is already started.

        Specified by:
        start in interface IListenerWrapper
